radiographic_examinations.findings: Evidence of acute appendicitis; enlarged, thickened appendix with mucosal hyperenhancement and periappendiceal fat stranding.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Abdominal CT scans obtained on the 31st hospital day showed resolution of both the appendiceal changes and the colonic-wall thickening.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Thickening of the sigmoid and descending colon consistent with colitis; unchanged appearance of the appendix, with no evidence of perforation; multiple prominent retroperitoneal lymph nodes, up to 1.1 cm in diameter.
Bilateral pulmonary nodules, 2 to 4 mm in diameter; no lymphadenopathy or pleural effusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: These pulmonary nodules had not been present on chest CT scans obtained 4 weeks earlier.
